Package edu.purdue.cs.percolator

Class AutoGrader

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.purdue.cs.percolator.AutoGrader
  • public final class AutoGrader
extends Object
    The AutoGrader class contains builder methods to create an auto-grader.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.2

    • Method Detail

      • grade

        public static AutoGrader grade​(Class<?>[] testSuites)
        Creates a new AutoGrader with the given test suites. The maximum score defaults to 100. The grading platform defaults to Gradescope.
        Parameters:
        testSuites - the classes to test
        Returns:
        a new AutoGrader object

      • withMaxScore

        public AutoGrader withMaxScore​(double maxScore)
        Specifies a maximum score for the test suites.
        Parameters:
        maxScore - the maximum score for the test suites
        Returns:
        the AutoGrader with the new max score

      • withStyleChecker

        public AutoGrader withStyleChecker​(StyleChecker styleChecker)
        Specifies a StyleChecker object to run a code style audit with after grading.
        Parameters:
        styleChecker - the style checker to run
        Returns:
        the AutoGrader with the new style checker

      • onGradescope

        public AutoGrader onGradescope()
        Specifies the grading platform to be Gradescope.
        Returns:
        the AutoGrader with the new platform setting

      • onVocareum

        public AutoGrader onVocareum()
        Specifies the grading platform to be Vocareum. When setting up an assignment in Vocareum, the rubric items should be named "Test Cases" and "Code Style". You can omit "Code Style" if you are not using a StyleChecker. In order to distinguish between the grading report and the grading rubric results, the grading report is printed to standard error, and the grading results are printed to standard out. When writing your grading script, it is recommended that you redirect output using the following sequence: 2>&1 1> $vocareumGradeFile.
        Returns:
        the AutoGrader with the new platform setting

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the grader and prints out the results.
